answers.answer: If it has got worse I'd go get checked again just in case it's pre eclampsia. If it's not serious swelling then I find lying down and raising my feet on pillows helps and a foot rub!
Same here. Swelling in feet and hands. Just make sure your face doesn't swell or you start getting a headache. That's signs of preeclampsia. I try to keep my feet up as much as possible.
I have had my feet up and it's not helped at all just keeps getting worse
Call your doc. They need to check your BP. If your BP is fine, then its just a normal pregnancy symptom. If its preeclampsia, your BP will be able to tell you!

I was that way for about 2 weeks then it went away a few days ago (39 weeks today) I heard your body retains water before labor, make sure you're getting plenty of liquids, elevate your feet and soak them in cold water for some relief. If it gets worse call your doctor!
I had my bp took 3days ago it's normally 110/60 that time it was 125/81 but it's not high enough they said that's still normal and only to contact them if I start getting sore heads.

question: I have had really bad swollen feet for over a week now.. Doctors say it's normal but seems to be getting worse what can I do to help??
title: Badly swollen feet 38weeks & 4days
